result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LISA M RAYBOURN

defendant.name: RAYBOURN, LISA M
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pretrial Status Report
Summary of Costs - $7,570.00

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

State's Exhibit #1 - Criminal Court Record 
State's Exhibit #2 - Bail Bond

State's Exhibit #1
State's Exhibit #2

1:11 PM Defendant LISA M RAYBOURN in court, in custody. Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for LISA M RAYBOURN.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not need to speak with her attorney. Amy Thoma sworn - is the Clerk of Court for Green Lake County and has been for almost 8 years. Direct by ADA McElroy. Exhibit #1 marked. Direct continues. Exhibit #2 marked. Direct continues. Witness identifies defendant in court, via the booking photo. Discussion held. ADA asks for the record to reflect the identification. So noted by the Court. ADA makes motion to offer exhibits 1 and 2 and into evidence. No objections. Court receives exhibits 1 and 2 into evidence. Cross by Atty Kapelis. No re-direct. No further witnesses. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. State is filing an information - mirrors the criminal complaint. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the information and waives its reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of NOT GUILTY. Court sets for return date on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 a.m. Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m. 

Atty Kapelis makes statement - wishes to address bond. Court goes back on the record at 1:21 p.m. Same appearances. Atty Kapelis makes statement regarding bond - requests reduction. ADA makes statement regarding bond. Court denies motion, bond remains. Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.
(Atty Michael Kapelis)

1:04 PM Defendant LISA M RAYBOURN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for the defendant.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CF185 and 22CF140. Statement by Atty Kapelis - defendant applied for the public defender but does not yet have counsel. Statement by the defendant. Defendant requests to proceed to the prelim without an attorney. Court states prelim will stay on the calendar as scheduled for case 22CF140. 

Court adjourned at 1:06 PM
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Spoke to Michaela in Dispatch.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. If defendant has her children, another adult must be present.

1:07 PM Defendant LISA M RAYBOURN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by video for LISA M RAYBOURN.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court will call 21CF185 and 22CF140. Court quashes both warrants. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. 

22CF140 - Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson states defendant does qualify for the public defender. Court sets bond at $1,000 cash bond in both cases and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. If defendant has her children, another adult must be present. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set 22CF140 for Status of Prelim Monday September 26, 2022 at 1:00 PM and Preliminary Hearing for September 27, 2022 at 2:00 PM. Court sets 22CF185 for Status Hearing.

Court adjourned at 1:13 PM
Sent to GLSO 08/16/22.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
